title: Polygon node crashing with out-of-control RAM usage
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: version 2022.99.99-dev-c1eef706

OS & Version: Windows 11 (Build 22000.856)

Commit hash : c1eef706b37334f8d6d98d3c73fc8a5377214cc8

PC: i9-11900H processor, 32 GB RAM, 2 TB M.2 disk

#### Expected behaviour

Successfully syncing a Polygon node with RAM usage not exceeding 16 GB as stated in the Erigon system requirements.

#### Actual behaviour

What I’m trying to do:
Run a Polygon node locally with Erigon on Windows 11.

What I have done:
I downloaded the latest Bor full node snapshot from https://snapshots.matic.today/ and extracted it into a folder: E:\polygon_bor_data.

I then start Erigon using these flags (following [this guide](https://polygontechnology.notion.site/Erigon-Usage-Guide-64be30e49b894ed8b3c6b3da8300acfb)):

`erigon.exe chain=bor-mainnet --bor.heimdall=https://heimdall.api.matic.network --datadir=E:\polygon_bor_data --port=30304 --http.port=8546 --authrpc.port=8552 --torrent.port=42068 --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9091 --http --ws --http.api=eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon`

When starting Erigon RAM usage quickly explodes to 100 % of my available 32 GB. Then Erigon starts to also fill my ~130 GB available paged memory space.

As this happens I repeatedly get a warning from Erigon saying that missing snapshots are being downloaded and also an error saying “="[1/16 Headers] BuildMissedIndices: compressed file is too short: 0"”.

> —downloader.verify

I have tried adding --downloader.verify now but the Erigon behaviour seems identical to the way it was without the flag. Same RAM usage, same warnings + error + crash.

This is the full startup configuration I used:

`erigon.exe chain=bor-mainnet --bor.heimdall=https://heimdall.api.matic.network --datadir=E:\polygon_bor_data --downloader.verify --port=30304 --http.port=8546 --authrpc.port=8552 --torrent.port=42068 --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9091 --http --ws --http.api=eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon`
